moves.1. e4: My opponent uses a popular opening: King's pawn opening.
moves.1... e6: I reply, almost mirroring my opponent.
moves.2... Bc5: I open up my bishop quickly.
moves.3... Qe7: Now my queen, I see that my opponent is not very strong after a4, I attempt a fast checkmate. If I was really being attacking and wanting to win quickly, I would have played Qf6.
moves.4. h3: This does nothing again, he should be opening up.
moves.4... f5: I threaten his pawn, being protected by my own.
moves.7... Nd7: I threaten his pawn with pawn with my knight.
moves.8. c3: Blocking in then knight, now I can take his pawn.
moves.10. Ke2: He could of played g3 (mate in two) but he decides there's no point.

gameName: An Easy, Short Game of Chess
